评论详情: I don’t normally write reviews…. But I love these shoes. I have very wide feet and have a difficult time finding shoes that fit with out hurting. They are lightweight and flexible. Have a small arch support in them. Not sure how they would hold up for a runner but for every day walking they are great for me. Didn’t want a heavy stiff shoe and these are the opposite. Love them…. Bought 2 colors. They run big so I bought 1 size smaller.
Shoes fit great and have plenty of room in the toe box. They are minimal enough for me to feel the ground but have the support I need as well.
A very comfortable lounge around, chill I'm public, fashionable shoes. Wouldn't use for exercise. But do use them to keep your feet in a comfortable barefoot position.

评论概述: Better than Xero, I’m not kidding
评论详情: I tried these out as a low cost introduction to barefoot shoes, and boy did they not disappoint! They’ve become my everyday shoe for a few months now (I was even gifted a pair of Xeros for Christmas and I’ll still prefer these over them). The flexibility allows me to feel the ground which has changed the way I walk, I feel like I practically glide. They seem to be holding up super well, no issues with the sole coming unglued which is typical for cheaper shoes. The only downside is that the laces are EXTREMELY long, so I recommend swapping them for shorter ones or elastic laces. Other than that they are amazing!

类型: Size: 12.5 WideColor: W81 Light Brown Gum
评论详情: It takes a while to get used to the width, but give them a try! Your toes and feet will feel great. My "regular" shoes feel so confining now.  These are "barefoot" shoes, so the soles are comparatively thin. That is a deliberate design, as it is said that one's feet need to feel the irregularities of the surface. This does take even more time to adjust, so to begin, chose your steps carefully.  Considering the price, give them a try, but take is slow to start. You will be glad, and surprised. I was!
Shoe has lasted almost 2 full years now, which is much longer than I thought it would. Comfortable, breathes well, and will buy another pair!

I got these for weight lifting. And they work well. I also have plantar fasciitis and I've been trying to build strength in my feet. They're surprisingly comfortable. But I do have to switch to orthopedic shoes after a couple hours

Had these for a year (or more???).  Like them so much I bought some all black ones for a more formal look on occasion.  I removed the foot beds to get a more minimalist feel.  If doing so you MIGHT want to consider going down half a size, but not bad to size with the footbed out in your regular size.When I wear through the sole completely (I'm getting close), will absolutely replace with the exact same thing.  Not even going to bother looking at other options.  Price is great, quality is great, looks are great, feel is great.
and quality is quite impressive for the price
Been using them almost two years now, other than some strands of fabric coming off they're still holding up although I only use them as house shoes.

评论概述: My favorite shoes. 8 months of daily wear. Inner liner is the weakest link.
评论详情: Ive been wearing barefoot/minimalist shoes for roughly 15 years. I have been through all the big brands in the space, and some of the little ones. Merrell, Vivobarefoot, Lems, Xero, Softstar, and Vibram to name a few.  For sports/fitness, I prefer 5 Fingers, but I don't want to wear those to work and just around. Ive been through so many other casual shoe types. They are very expensive, and you don't get more for your money. Merrell used to be my fav, but their designs and durability have gone away. Vivobarefoot is ok, but they are expensive as heck. Lems are too padded, softstars are made of leather and can be decent, but they look a little silly too. I always want to like xero shoes, but they just are never quite comfortable, and spendy.  Enter Whitin... I discovered these a few years ago. Not all the styles work for me. Some are too narrow, and some of the styles are a bit dopey. But these are just shoes. Not too thick, not too thin. Exterior is extremely durable and sheds dirt and stuff kindof magically and automatically. I haven't washed the shoes in the pictures for 8 months, and i just went dumpster diving yesterday and got them all dusty... they still look reasonable. I've NEVER had a sole delaminate from a whitin shoe. The other style i had before these was a bit better in overall durability, but was a bit narrow and flared up by bunion issue. Those ones lasted till the sole wore through.  These ones do have a couple downsides. They wont last forever. The weak link in this style is the inner liner. It wore through wear the sole pushes in while my foot pushes out. This let tiny rocks work their way into the layers of the liner behind my heel, and i cant get them out, so im calling this pair dead after 8 months. I have already ordered another. 40$ for 8 months of daily wear and abuse works for me.

3 months of almost every day wear and wish a quick wash they look like new.  I’ve actually washed these a few times - they’re holding up really well.  *I did replace the insoles with my preferred ones when I got them. Being able to easily replace them with my Good Feet Store insoles was actually a factor for choosing these.  The lining of these shoes feel like a thick t-shirt - very soft.  I kinda love these… and will get another pair when these wear out!  * I feel confident that I’ll get 6 months of use, at least.

评论概述: Soles lasted for 1.5 years as daily drivers
评论详情: Generally a great shoe! The sole wore out but the rest of the fabric is still in good condition. I'd say if you weren't wearing these for everything they might last you a bit longer.  I purchased them for $20 back in July 2023 but for todays price I'd want them to last longer than that. The sole has a hole on the ball of my left foot, which is a good sign because you're supposed to walk on the ball of your feet and that area gets the most impact.  I'm going to try to repair them with shoe goo to make them last to the summer and when I replace them I'll probably look around for a harder sole to last a bit longer.

评论概述: Good Gym Shoe for Squats and Deadlifts
评论详情: I wouldn't run with these but they are great for small walks on even pavement.

These shoes look a little wide at first but they are very comfortable. They don’t get in the way of driving, I haven’t gotten any blisters, and they come on and off super easily without falling off during wearing. When water gets in, the shoes dry out very fast.
I’ve been trying to find wide foot shoes due to most shoes being too narrow for my feet, these are fantastic and I feel like I have more balance now.

Back in the late 60's and early 70s, there was lots of competition, a brand named Barefoot Gear was competing with the likes of Nike, Adidas, Tiger and others. I had a pair, and I loved them. Unfortunately, they went out of business when it came time to replace them.  These have the exact same feeling.
Can’t beat these for the money
Takes some getting used to. Back pain has minimized and foot pain is almost completely gone. My feet hurt 95% less than they ever did with other shoes. They also hold up very well for their price.

Love these for everything but heavy (bad) weather.  Great kicking around walking shoe for inside or fair weather.  Definitely going to get another pair of these.
I bought myself and my son a pair. After a few months they still look brand new!

评论概述: Could be great, mine had issies
评论详情: I have to send them back… the left shoe has extra material or something on the tongue and doesn’t fit well.  They are every light, I find the insole to be very slippery, not a fan of the upper material (it just feels cheap and like it won’t last).  When you put them on, it feels like the soles are very light/thin. I’m not sure if that’s good or bad as I didn’t get to use them. Looking at them from the outside, they look good and like they will last.  Overall? They are worth giving them a chance at the price range.

评论概述: Haven't been paid don't work for them
评论详情: So so I just got these on Saturday through the mail I've just worn them a few times so far so if there's any problems I'll update this but as of right now I really like them they're light they're bendy you can feel the ground underneath the pad and I weigh about 450 doesn't hurt my feet or anything else like that it's actually a very quite pleasant I'm actually planning on ordering another pair with these need to be replaced definitely would recommend

So, I have insanely wide feet, and can never find shoes that don’t feel like they’re smooshing my toes and the front of my foot. These shoes are AMAZING. I measured my foot, and went by their chart and they fit according to the size chart (they run a tad small for US sizing) they’re durable, I’ve wore them every day for 3 months and they still look brand new. The material is breathable and light, and my feet don’t feel like they’re suffocating in them. Superior functionality as they allow my feet to flex the way they’re designed to. The first couple days my feet were sore at the end of the day; but that’s just par for the course when you first start out in barefoot shoes. They are not warm, and definitely not waterproof, but they do dry out relatively quickly when wearing them. Overall, love these and will for sure be buying more whenever these wear out!
They fit to size. They feel strange at first if you've never worn this kind of "barefoot" wide toe box shoe. But once you're used to them, I could wear these all the time.
I started having problems with pain in my hips after wearing these shoes for several months.  After I quit wearing the shoes, my hip problems went away.

I really like these shoes. They are nice looking and seem like they will be durable enough. They feel like a moccasin, so be advised that they have very little padding and no arch support, which I personally don't mind. They're pretty grippy too.

I have had these for atleast 4 months I wear them everyday. Comfy, minimalistic, they look great(imo). I work with the deceased family so I have to look professional, I stopped wearing my dress shoes. These look good enough to pass. No rips or tares yet, they breath very well. They fit me and true to size. Wide toe box is awesome! Can wear and walk in them all day with no issue. They have decent grip(nothing real aggressive). I was wanting xero or hobi minimal shoes but why pay $80+ for minimal and simple shoes? Kinda annoying to think about how less goes into primal type shoes yet they try to charge more. I WILL KEEP BUYING THESE UNTIL THY CHANGE OR STOP MAKING THEM, LIKE A BORING GRANDMA.

Good and very comfortable for a few months and eventually the soles on the inside wear down fast and the fit eventually becomes loose and doesn’t feel “stable” but it did look very nice and these were amazing the first few months. No pain whatsoever
If you are a 1/2 size go up 1 size and you'll be walking in no time
very comfortable but slippery on wet concrete.

These sneakers are exactly what they advertise. The black canvass sneaker looks like any other sneaker at quick glance making them perfect for wearing them at work and not drawing attention to them. If this is your first foray into the "barefoot" market, just know you are supposed to be able to feel the ground beneath your feet more, you will feel rocks, sticks, etc...

This is the best place to start to get a feeling for what it’s like to wear a barefoot shoe. You don’t need to spend more money to get an idea of what it’s like because these give you what you need. Zero drop, wide toe box, and a thin soul for that ground feedback. I have since bought a pair of Xero shoes, and although the construction is obviously superior, it is a lot more of a shoe and it’s not actually as wide as this. This is perfect as just a casual shoe for what is currently a great price.
Very comfortable! Will buy again in other colors

I am new to wide toe box and barefoot shoes. These are reasonably priced and have been working out fine so far. A great starter shoe for those not wanting to spend a lot having never tried a barefoot shoe. Not water resistant with the canvas, be sure to avoid puddles at all costs as these are zero drop with no cushion, so you will get wet in rainy conditions if you’re not careful. Seems to fit true to size

This is my first pair of Whitin shoes and also my first pair of wide toe box shoes.  They also just happen to be the most comfortable pair of shoes I've ever owned.  There is no break-in period.  They were amazing from the first time I put them on.  With that said, they are also probably the goofiest looking pair of shoes I've ever owned.  I wear a size 13 so I jokingly refer to these as my clown shoes.  However, I'm at the age where I'm not concerned with the look of my shoes as much as the comfort.I bought a couple pairs of Brooks shoes recently and had to go to a size 14 to allow for sufficient space for my toes.  As a result it feels like I'm wearing skis, which is especially annoying when I'm driving my manual transmission car.  They work great for my running routine and for when I'm going to be on my feet all day, but that's about it.  The Whitin shoes with the wide toe box allow me to buy a size 13 which fits much better and allows me to feel the peddles in my MT much more.I highly recommend these shoes and I'm sure this will be my first pair of many!
looks durable but the sole need better thicker esp on the back

评论概述: Held up well; great ground-feel; super wide
评论详情: I have wildly wide feet and these are super comfortable. For reference, I got Lems' widest shoe, even went up 1/2 size, and it was TOO NARROW.  On the flip side, these Whitins fit super well. SIf your feet are dummy thiqq (wide), these are for you. I hike in them, go to the gym, and wear them just about everywhere every day. Had them for over a year now without any tears or failures. Super impressed. Wish they made a winter boot with better traction! These are horrifying in the snow/ice, though -- incredibly slippery.

I'm in my 40s, so I've worn a few pairs of shoes in my life. I cannot get over how comfortable these are. My feet hurt all the time, from the moment I wake up until I'm falling asleep but they feel the best wearing these shoes. Better than barefoot around the house; better than work boots with fancy inserts; better than off my feet on the couch. I have no idea why this is the case, I sincerely wish I did because it might shed some light on the overall problem but, for now, I'll enjoy the unexplainable. I haven't had these long, so no testimonial on the durability and longevity yet but they're proving to be a good deal for the price paid. They fit great, according to standard sizing. I'm not mountain climbing in these, mostly my days-off-from-work shoes, but I've had no complaints their performance running errands, taking the dog on walks etc.
